Class Prescription

java.lang.Object
models.Prescription
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Prescription extends Object implements Serializable
Class representing a medication prescription in the hospital management system. This class holds details about a specific prescription, including the medication name, quantity, and status.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Prescription

      public Prescription(String medicationName, int quantity)
      Constructs a Prescription object with the specified medication name and quantity. The status is initialized to "pending".
      Parameters:
      medicationName - The name of the medication prescribed.
      quantity - The quantity of the medication prescribed.

  • Method Details

    • getMedicationName

      public String getMedicationName()
      Gets the name of the medication prescribed.
      Returns:
      The name of the medication.

    • getStatus

      public String getStatus()
      Gets the current status of the prescription. The status can be "pending" or "dispensed".
      Returns:
      The status of the prescription.

    • setStatus

      public void setStatus(String status)
      Sets the status of the prescription. This can be used to mark the prescription as either "pending" or "dispensed".
      Parameters:
      status - The new status of the prescription.

    • getQuantity

      public int getQuantity()
      Gets the quantity of the medication prescribed.
      Returns:
      The quantity of medication prescribed.

    • setQuantity

      public void setQuantity(int quantity)
      Sets the quantity of the medication prescribed.
      Parameters:
      quantity - The new quantity of medication to prescribe.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the prescription, including the medication name and quantity.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representing the prescription details.
